name: Koala
headline: Minecraft for Teachers
description:
PROBLEM 😩

Zoom is great for adults, not ideal to engage an 8 year old online.

SOLUTION 🔥

Koala Go, the award-winning interactive platform for online teaching businesses.

Learn more at https://teachwithkoala.com/

founders.name: Xavier Lesage Moretti, Founder
founders.description:
Xavier was born and raised in Paris, France. 
When he turned 21, he got an internship at Apple in California and never came back to France.
Xavier currently lives in San Francisco with his fiancée.
He would not trade his entrepreneurial life for anything.
Xavier's favorite TV show are West Wing and Friends.
He's a decent skier, basketball player and plays real time strategy games.

[![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/img/icons/browser-dark.svg)Open Koala Go](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/<https:/classroom.teachwithkoala.com?>)

Want to learn more about Koala?
## Register to our weekly live Koala demo
[Register Now](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/<https:/bit.ly/koala_beginner_training>)
## Koala Possibilities
Teacher & kid friendly
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
### An interactive kid-friendly environment
Koala is a fun and collaborative learning space where your students will excel and flourish.
[Open Koala Go](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/<https:/classroom.teachwithkoala.com>)
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
3D room
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
Avatars
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
Video-call
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
### Teacher Controls
Koala Go gives teachers control over student permissions, from drawing to interacting with the co-browser.
[Open Koala Go](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/<https:/classroom.teachwithkoala.com>)
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
Student Permissions
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
Activities
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
### Everything in one place
You can do everything with Koala - upload PDF's and PPTs, invoice your clients or use your favorite websites such as Wordwall, Raz Kids, and Genially. 
[Open Koala Go](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/<https:/classroom.teachwithkoala.com>)

![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
## Engage your students with Koala!
Ready to start your journey?
[![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)Open Koala Go](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/<https:/classroom.teachwithkoala.com>)
## Common Questions
Do I always have the same link to invite my students or does it change?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
Yes, you always have the same link. It’s one link you can share with all your students. It does not change.
To get your link, go to Koala Go Classroom > Invite Student > Copy the link
Does my invite link depend on the activity I am in?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
No, your link is always the same, regardless of which activity you’re in.
How do I add images to Koala Go?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
You can simply drag and drop images into Koala Go classroom.
How to request a new feature for Koala Go?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
We love to hear from you about what features can make the product better. Please add your feature request at [this page](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/<https:/teachwithkoala.canny.io/feature-request>) by creating a post. Note that you can also upvote existing feature requests. Posted by other users.
What are the minimum system requirements to support Koala Go?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
A stable connection.
Downlink speed: 1Mbps+
Uplink speed: 1 Mbps+
A device with a browser
Are all browsers supported?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
Not yet. Today **we do not support the Wechat embedded browser** and the Samsung Android browser. Here are the browsers that we recommend:
If you're on PC: Please use Chrome, Edge or Brave
On Mac: Chrome, Edge or Brave
On Chromebook: Chrome
On iPad: Safari
My student’s parents don’t speak English. Do you have any parent guides in Chinese that I can send them to help with onboarding?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
Yes, one of the tutors, Sarah, from our wonderful Koala Go tutor community made a comprehensive parent guide in Chinese with both Chinese and English subtitles: <https://youtu.be/kY4taV2vzOs>. She even posted the video on BiliBili, the Chinese video website, so that parents can access the videos without restriction: <https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1UP411X7HC>
How does the Koala Go invoicing system work? What are the benefits of invoicing using Koala Go?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
Parents from any country can pay in their local currency, using popular local payment methods (such as credit cards in the US or WeChat in China). Tutors get paid through their preferred methods amongs PayPal, Venmo, or Square Cash. That’s how simple it is! Your business will be streamlined and you can focus on growing it. Tutor Caitlin made this wonderful video to explain the benefits and how to have the conversation with the parents. Video link: <https://youtu.be/fjxmf24oj6Q>
Can I send an invoice with Koala Go even if I don't use it for teaching?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
Anyone can send an invoice with Koala Go. Whether you use it to teach or not.
  1. Go to <https://classroom.teachwithkoala.com/>
  2. Sign in with gmail or any email
  3. Click on the avatar in the top right menu
  4. Click on “Send Invoice”
  5. Follow the process and send your invoice


Do I need a Koala Pro package to use invoicing?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
No, you can invoice through Koala even if you don’t teach on Koala.
If I already have a Standard Stripe account, do I still need an Express account connected to Koala?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
Yes, you still need an Express account, but it’ll take just 3 minutes to set it up 🙂 And you won’t ever have to manage Stripe again!
Which country does my bank need to be in to use an Express Stripe account?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
As of Jun 2022, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Norway, Portugal, Spain, Singapore, Sweden, Switzerland, UK, and USA.
I don’t have a website. Can I still get a Stripe Express account?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
Yes, you can choose to enter a business description instead of a website.
What if I live in a country that is not supported by Stripe?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
You can continue to use the existing invoicing system and get paid via PayPal.
Why does it look like my avatar is walking in slow motion in Playground?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
This is likely because your hardware acceleration is off in your browser. If you are using Google Chrome, follow [these instructions](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/<https:/www.howtogeek.com/412738/how-to-turn-hardware-acceleration-on-and-off-in-chrome/>) to turn hardware acceleration on
I already have a Stripe account. Can I use this existing one or do I need to create a new one?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
Unfortunately, you'll need to create a new Stripe account with us.
Why haven’t I received my payment yet on Stripe?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
It can take up to a week for automatic payouts. You can request a payout immediately on your Stripe dashboard.
If I sell an activity on the marketplace, what's the total fee?
![](https://www.teachwithkoala.com)
Koala takes a 15% fee from Koala Go marketplace sales and Stripe takes a flat fee of $0.30 and 2.9%.
Below is an example for an activity that creator A sells on the marketplace for $24.
The buyer pays $24 with a credit card, then: Stripe will take 30 cents flat fee + 2.9% of $24 => Stripe fee = $1 Koala will take 15% of $24 which is $3.6 Creator A gets the rest which is 24-3.6-1 = $19.4
Note: If buyer is outside of the US, Stripe takes 3.9% instead of 2.9%
[Blog](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/<https:/www.teachwithkoala.com/blog>)
©2025 by Koala
[](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/<https:/www.facebook.com/groups/teachwithkoala>)[](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/<https:/www.youtube.com/channel/UChy4_KSf0B83uxMAFtp1T6Q?view_as=subscriber>)[](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/<https:/twitter.com/StudiosEinstein>)[](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/<https:/www.linkedin.com/company/18917720/>)[](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/<https:/www.instagram.com/teachwithkoala/>)[](https://www.teachwithkoala.com/<https:/www.pinterest.com/TeachWithKoala/_saved/>)

generated_description:
**Koala: Making Learning Fun for Kids Online**

Koala was founded in 2020 with a mission that's brilliantly simple: create an engaging online learning environment for teachers and students alike, kicking traditional video conferencing to the curb, especially when it comes to figuring out how to keep an 8-year-old engaged. Zoom might work for adults, but for kids? Not so much. Koala aims to change that.

Drawing on the allure of gaming and the immersive potential of the metaverse, Koala has crafted an award-winning platform called Koala Go, designed specifically for educators in the rapidly evolving world of online teaching. Based in the vibrant tech hub of San Francisco, the Koala team—just 11 strong—provides a refreshingly unique solution to the common challenges of digital education.

### Why Koala?

1. **Engaging Environment**: Koala Go offers a dynamic and visually stimulating interactive classroom that keeps kids engaged. It’s like a virtual playground for learning.
   
2. **Teacher Control**: Teachers can manage student permissions, allowing for tailored experiences from drawing to browsing. They hold the reins, so to speak.

3. **All-in-One Platform**: Upload PDFs, invoicing, and linking to favorite educational websites all happen under one digital roof. The platform houses everything teachers need to conduct a successful class.

4. **Avatars and Interactivity**: Students can create customizable avatars and participate in interactive games, making learning a more fun and collaborative process.

### Testimonials Tell the Truth

Teachers are raving about Koala. Testimonials highlight how students remain engaged throughout lessons and progress quickly through materials, often commenting that the experience feels much more lively and enjoyable than traditional setups. One literacy teacher even said, “It was like opening a Christmas present!” — now that’s a ringing endorsement.

Koala is part of Y Combinator’s Winter 2022 batch, positioning it among innovative startups poised for success. With its innovative model, Koala is carving out a niche in the education market that resonates with both children and teachers. 

### Get Involved

Whether you’re a teacher looking for an innovative platform to connect with students, or just curious about the internet’s new favorite virtual classroom, you can find out more at [Koala's website](https://www.teachwithkoala.com). They even offer a weekly training on how to use Koala Go, along with a free month of Koala Pro to get you started.

As new challenges in education arise, it’s clear that Koala is not just adapting; it’s innovating. And that’s something we can all get behind.
